_header: To you well of honour and worthiness
Title(s): ‘Balade au tres noble Roy H[enri] le quint’
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, ‘Balade au tres noble Roy H[enri] le quint’ — four 8-line stanzas (same three rimes throughout)

CamTCC595.First Lines:
To you wele of honor and of worthynesOure christen kinge the heire
                    and successourvnto Iustinians deuout tenderneIn faithe of Iesu oure
                    redemptour…
CamTCC595.Last Lines:
…Obserue it well there to be þe dettourDoeth so and god
                    in glory shall you stall
CamTCC595.Note: Added to flyleaf by a hand of sixteenth century. Transcript from  Geoffrey Chaucer, Workes, Thynne, 1532 . Followed, without break, by 6826.
CamTCC595.Attributed Title:
To the kinges moste noble grace and To the Lordes and Knightes of the
                    garter (f. 2)

HunHM111.First Lines:
To yow welle of honur and worthynesseOur right cristen kyng heir
                    & successour…
HunHM111.Last Lines:
…Obserue it wel ther to been yee dettourDooth so and god in
                    glorie shal yow stalle
HunHM111.Attributed Title:
Cestes balades ensuyantes feurent faites au tresnoble Roy Henri le quint
                        que dieu pardoint & au treshonorable conpaignie du Iarter (f.
                    27)
HunHM111.Editions:
